item.title: Senate bill seeks creation of online legal knowledge, assistance system
item.description: Senator Lito Lapid announced in a Saturday statement that he had filed Senate Bill No. 1751 which would create a National Legal Knowledge and Assistance System which would serve as an online repository of different Philippine laws, rules, and regulations.

item.title: 4,351 new cases push Philippines COVID-19 tally to almost 158,000
item.description: The Philippines on Saturday reported 4,351 new coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19) infections, bringing the nationwide total to 157,918, according to the Department of Health (DOH).

item.title: PNP, AFP on alert vs. possible reprisals after Abu Sayyaf leader Susukan's arrest
item.description: Security forces were on alert Saturday for possible reprisal attacks after arresting a key leader of the Abu Sayyaf Group accused of kidnapping and beheading several foreigners.

item.title: US Navy carrier conducted exercises in South China Sea on Aug. 14 --US military
item.description: A US Navy aircraft carrier conducted exercises in the contested South China Sea on Friday, the US Navy said in a statement.

item.title: DA-CAR to sell 5,000 kilos of Chinese cabbage weekly to arrest price drop
item.description: The Department of Agriculture-Cordillera Administrative Region (DA-CAR) is planning to sell thousands of kilograms of cabbage from the region to Metro Manila, in a bid to arrest the price drop of vegetables in Benguet brought by oversupply.

item.title: CHR gravely concerned over Davao terrorist-tagging posters
item.description: The Commission on Human Rights (CHR) on Saturday expressed its "grave" concern after nine individuals were tagged as terrorist recruiters - their names and photos displayed in posters in Davao City's Barangay Ma-a.

item.title: PNP monitors pensioners through buddy system with active personnel
item.description: The Philippine National Police (PNP) has launched a program to track and monitor police pensioners through a buddy system with the active police personnel, as well as promote camaraderie between them.

item.title: Comelec to resume voter registration on September 1
item.description: The Commission on Elections on Saturday announced that voter registrations are set to resume on September 1, 2020.

item.title: On 75th anniversary of end of World War 2, gov't vows to take care of veterans
item.description: The government vowed on Saturday to take care of living war veterans and widows of veterans who passed away as the country marked the 75th anniversary of the end of World War 2.

item.title: Bicam OK'd suspension of telco towers permit requirement --Drilon
item.description: The bicameral conference committee has adopted a proposed provision in the Bayanihan to Recover as Once Act or “Bayanihan 2” that temporarily suspends the requirement for certain permits for the installation and operation of telecommunication towers in the next three years.

item.title: Camp Crame to implement 'no face shield, no entry' policy in PNP NHQ starting Aug. 17
item.description: The Philippine National Police on Saturday said police personnel, civilian employees and visitors entering its National Headquarters in Camp Crame, Quezon City will be required to wear face shields starting Monday, August 17.

item.title: COVID Shield seeks TODA leaders' help in quarantine rules enforcement
item.description: The Joint Task Force COVID Shield has sought assistance from transport leaders for the strict implementation of quarantine rules in their areas of responsibility, following reports that some tricycle drivers are still not wearing face masks, and not ensuring passengers' physical distancing.

item.title: Resource persons reveal fraudulent schemes in PhilHealth at DOJ hearing
item.description: Two resource persons formerly connected with the Philippine Health Insurance Corporation have revealed fraudulent schemes by officers and employees of the agency in the first investigative hearing of the Task Force PhilHealth, the Department of Justice said on Saturday.

item.title: Palace dodges recommendation for NEDA s Karl Chua to lead PhilHealth
item.description: Malacañang on Saturday maintained that the power to appoint officials in non-elective positions is the sole prerogative of the President.

item.title: Palace: Gov't has enough allocation for printing of learning modules
item.description: The government has enough budget to fund the printing of learning modules to be used by students for School Year 2020-2021, Presidential spokesperson Harry Roque said Saturday.
